page.title: 05Farming and Forestry.
page.content: The area around Hartwell and Ashton is heavily farmed.Most of the farms are arable and grow monocultures of wheat or barley with occasional fields of oil -seed.Only one farm has beef cattle and there are no dairy herds.The boulder clay soil is so heavy that Park farm has to deep plough every year with a crawler.Recently some farmers have begun to grow potatoes but already the prices are making this not worthwhile & there is talk of a return to beef or sheep herds,the traditional farming for this area.In Salcey Forest new planting must now be oak and conifer mixed since the forest is now a {Site of Special Scientific Interest}.Some coppices have wood banks still but the timber crop is taken by clear-felling and this changed the whole character of the forest. Chad Shakespeare,11.
